Articles.Content: I've seen it mentioned but never seen an example. I've done forum searches, advanced and normal, to no avail. Anyone care to explain how a "decoupler-based suspension" works, and how to build one? Put the wheels on decouplers? What kind of decouplers? Please post pics... I want to create this insane stunt spacecraft, but it needs a very good suspension to... well, if it works, you'll see

Mount radial decouplers where you want your wheels, and then mount your wheels to the radial decouplers

Also works with clamp-o-trons (you can even body-clamp><clamp-wheel for even further springiness)
Structural components (particularly ibeams) also work. They're stiffer than the decouplers but also stronger, and so are my go-to "axle" parts for heavier rovers.

I don't know that there's anything special about decouplers other than that they're lightweight and easy to attach. I've had some fun using Linear RCS Ports as springs, because they are surface-mountable and very, very small. A stack of some (~5) of them is very very (even problematically) springy, and even looks a little like a spring.
